page.title: 12EDUCATION, GRAINTHORPE
page.content: Grainthorpe C.P. is a mixed Infant and Junior school.The original building,opened in 1852,and enjoyed a spasmodic life until the Education Act of 1871. The school records date from 24th April 1871. A teaching Head,one fulltime and one part-time assistant share about 56 children. The school is non-denominational, but has a Christian outlook. At the end of their last Junior Year at the age of 11+,the children leave to attend John Birkbeck High School,North Somercotes. The four schools in the Louth Plan for secondary education (Cordeaux High School,John Birkbeck High School,King Edward VI School and Monks' Dyke High School)work together to form one comprehensive unit,serving the Louth/North Somercotes catchment area.
